intro: Dombeya borbonica, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Dombeya borbonica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats.
